Articles.Content:
Hey everyone,

Since few hours im trying to connect my two space station parts. So far i managed to connect a main docking port to side docking port.

But i cannot connect two MAIN's (like on the picture).

Is it somehow related to the dock ports covers? Can those two even be connected?

Im doing docking manually. And yes, i do remember about setting the target and controlling from a point. Wierd thing is, when i managed to connect main port from vessel 1 to side port from vessel 5, just before connection i had to open the shield, otherwise it didn't work :S.
Looks like you have RCS thrusters or something inside the docking port, it's hard to tell, take a better picture in the sunlight so we can have a better look.
I'm sorry, but we'll need a clearer picture of the problem parts. A better side angle on it and more direct light would help.

As people are saying it looks almost like there is something small stuck in the docking port. From my own experence I have one suspicion - when you turned on symmetry you may have accidently ended up with two docking ports overlapping each other on either 2 or 4 of the side mounting points. I've encountered that unintentional duplication/clipping before with the hub part. Is there any kind of shimmering on the docking port, particularly when you move the camera? If so there is almost certainly a part clipped inside the docking port that is interfering.

Here are two pictures :

I have two station parts like this, pretty similiar. I want to connect them with front docking ports.

What about the "docking bug"? I looked into the savefile and some of the ports have "docked" status even tho, they're not docked.

Edited December 15, 2013 by Chantaz

I would try using regular docking ports, but if you insist on having the covered ones I'd move the 400EC batteries, you can probably just delete them, you have enough batt power with the 1K under the port.
Yes, shielded ports must always be opened before docking.

Snip

What about the "docking bug"? I looked into the savefile and some of the ports have "docked" status even tho, they're not docked.

You could try clearing that and see if that fixes the issue, I can see no problem with your port setup (If you would like you can post the craft file and we can see what's going on)

I've rebuild the station and now it's working, it works with regular port (not covered).

Somehow i couldn't connect the covered ones together. No idea why, maybe it was happening because of the batteries. Oh well, thanks everyone
